page.title: 12Home-life in Guisborough I
page.content: We chose Claire Hall,aged 10 out of her 3rd year class at Belmont Junior School to write about her week- end. She writes: On Saturdays my family get up about 9. We go to Redcar to shop;my Gran lives there so we have dinner with her while my Dad does her garden. Back home again I play with Vicky,who lives over the road,or back-garden tennis with Julie from next door.After tea I watch Dynasty,then have my supper, a shower and go to bed. On Sundays,up at 8.30.Often we pack a picnic & go hiking with Jet,our dog.Last week we saw dead sheep,& dragon flies over a river.I found lots of pheasant & partridge feathers.My sister didn't come because she's re- hearsing a play called Insects in which she's a frog.
